thread.title: Softball: Buford takes out North Oconee to move into 8-AAAA title bout
thread.title_full: Softball: Buford takes out North Oconee to move into 8-AAAA title bout

author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Softball: Buford takes out North Oconee to move into 8-AAAA title bout
text:
Buford's Peyton Wolfe Related Articles Softball: North Hall clinches 8-AAAA title game berth Softball: Region tournaments finally back in action after rainouts Softball: Lady Trojans take opening series of 8-AAAA tournament Softball: Lady Falcons advance to state with sweep of Lanier 
BUFORD — The Buford softball team will play for its fourth straight Region 8-AAAA title on Saturday after pushing past North Oconee in two games in the region tournament semifinals in Buford. 
The Lady Wolves (21-2) doubled up North Oconee 6-3 in Game 1 and then edged out the Lady Titans 5-4 in Game 2 to set up a showdown with North Hall in the championship battle at 1 p.m. Saturday in Buford. 
Buford scored three unanswered runs in the bottom of the sixth inning to break up a 3-3 tie, and take Game 1. Peyton Wolfe earned the win in relief of starter Logan Caymol, pitching 1 2/3 innings without giving up any runs. 
Baylee Sexton helped lead the offense, going 3 for 4, with an RBI, two runs scored and two stolen bases, while senior Lea Edwards finished 2 for 3, with 2 RBI. Gabby Benson also had a hit and a run scored. 
Buford came from behind in Game 2, scoring four runs in the top of the seventh inning to complete the sweep. Sexton capped the surge with a three-run, inside-the-park home run to give the Lady Wolves the lead. Wolfe earned her second win of the night in relief, pitching 1 1/3 innings without allowing a hit or run. 
Drew Puckett also finished with a double, RBI and a run scored, while Benson had a hit and a run scored. Breanna Gutierrez also doubled and scored a run. Associated Tags : High school softball, Buford softball © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
